methods.name: grabMouse
javadoc: Will set the focus to ingame if the Minecraft window is the active with focus. Also clears any GUI screen currently displayed

methods.name: isMouseGrabbed
javadoc: Returns true if the mouse is grabbed.

methods.name: onMove
javadoc: Will be called when the cursor is moved.

The callback function receives the cursor position, measured in screen coordinates but relative to the top-left corner of the window client area. On platforms that provide it, the full sub-pixel cursor position is passed on.

methods.name: onPress
javadoc: Will be called when a mouse button is pressed or released.

methods.name: onScroll
javadoc: Will be called when a scrolling device is used, such as a mouse wheel or scrolling area of a touchpad.

methods.name: releaseMouse
javadoc: Resets the player keystate, disables the ingame focus, and ungrabs the mouse cursor.
